Detailed Description

This is an abstract class which is instantiated using the App2 and App3 classes.

The class holds appearence information for Nodes, and can be used for both 2D and 3D objects.

See also:
App2
App2
Author:
Ben Constable, original Java code by Oli Winks
Version:
1.0

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

App::App (  )

Default constructor.

Initialises all appearance information to default, and inheritance to true for all components.

Creates a SHALLOW copy of all appearance information.

void App::inherit ( int  options ) [inline]

Takes a number of bit visual component options to inherit.

Options are defined higher up in this header file. Inheriting means that the App uses its parent's visual state, rather than its own. Apps inherit by default.

Parameters:
optionslist of options. Need to be 'or'd' e.g App::COLOUR || App::ALPHA ...
App& App::operator= ( const App &  rhs )

Assignment operator.

Creates a SHALLOW copy of all appearance information.

Parameters:
rhsApp to copy from
Returns:
this
void App::override ( int  options ) [inline]

Takes a number of bit visual component options to override.

Options are defined higher up in this header file. Overriding means that the App uses its own visual state, rather than its parent's.

Parameters:
optionslist of options. Need to be 'or'd' e.g App::COLOUR || App::ALPHA ...
